title: Couple who won £1million on Lotto spend jackpot on luxury 'man shed' for husband
text:

A couple who won £1million on the lottery three years ago have now shared how they spent the money.

Steve and Jill Walsh, from Anlaby, Hull, won the live-changing amount on the Lotto Millionaire Raffle on December 14, 2016 and celebrated their win by buying a home and creating a very special “man shed” – something Steve had always dreamed of having.

The diving-obsessed 59-year-old named his 'secret' hideaway The Dive Inn because of his diving passion and the couple's shared love of cruising.

He told Hull Live : "Before we won the lottery, I used to joke that I wanted my own space – but we didn’t even own our own home.

“Thanks to our National Lottery win we were able to buy a four-bed house and now I have my own bolt-hole too – my man shed which I designed myself and filled with memories of our lives from both before and after the win.

(Image: Nigel Roddis/Hull Daily Mail)

“We kept the nautical theme too, with life buoys, model yachts and a ship’s wheel on the walls.

“There is also a corner for my music and guitars, a bar which serves all my favourite tipples and pictures on the wall showing the great places Jill and I have been to since winning the Lottery.

“It cost several thousand pounds to convert the garage into my very own inn – but it’s now my favourite local."

Steve's wife Jill, 62, was the one who found out the couple had won after coming home from a 13-hour late shift at Castle Hill Hospital.

She had played the raffle online and received an email to say that she needed to check her Lotto account, but never thought it would be such a large amount.

She said she "felt sick" upon finding out the extent of her prize and that she had "the shock of her life".

(Image: Getty Images)

"I was absolutely shattered after coming in from a 13-hour night shift, but I got the shock of my life when I found out that we had won £1m and I don't think that either of us slept properly for at least five days," said Mrs Walsh.

"I felt sick. It was just unbelievable. You know that theoretically everyone has the chance at winning when they play, but you never think it would be you.

"It was just before Christmas and it absolutely changed our lives. I was going to retire in the February but could retire early and Steve now works four days a week.

"We were renting a house off the housing association but we now have our own and have helped our kids get on the property ladder too, as well as going on cruises, and still have money left over.

"Steve really is proud of his man cave that we had built - he had a wooden shed in the other house with a booze fridge in it but now he has his own proper place to go to. I join him there now and again for a drink, but I've got my own gym shack to go to as well."

Steve's man shed is set to feature in a unique and uplifting photo exhibition to mark the 25th birthday of The National Lottery.

The photo exhibition will be placed at the historic lottery-funded Fulham Palace in London and runs from October 30 to November 10.

It showcases the inspiring, obscure and heartfelt stories behind what winners of The National Lottery have purchased with their prize money.
description: Steve and Jill Walsh, from Hull, won the huge sum of money on the Lotto Millionaire Raffle in 2016
